decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The first floor rear extension by reason of its excessive width and overall bulk would fail to provide a proportionate, balanced, subordinate and harmonious addition to the host dwellinghouse, and would result in an overly dominant, obtrusive, and incongruous form of development that would subsume the rear elevation of the host property, and would fail to respect the character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse, neighbouring properties and the prevailing pattern of development in the locality contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3 (D(1) and (11)) of The  London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A, DM1 B (a), (b) and (c) of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).

Reason : 2 - The proposed ground floor side to rear extension and first floor side to rear extension by reason of its siting and rearward projection would give rise to an overbearing, unneighbourly and visually obtrusive form of development which would result in an unacceptable impact on the amenities of no.31 Worple Way. The proposed development would thereby be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3 D (7) of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the relevant provisions of the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Single storey front extension incorporating porch; single and two storey side extension; single and two storey rear extension; alterations to roof; front dormer; external alterations (demolition of entrance canopy and rear extension)
